title: 6 Easy Ways to Get Rid of a Cleft Chin

steps.title: Get filler injections.
steps.content: Get filler injections. Dermal filler is injected directly into your cleft chin to fill in the visible gap. This raises the skin over your cleft and leaves you with a smooth, even chin immediately after the injection. The results are not permanent as filler typically lasts 6 to 12 months, so you need to keep receiving injections to maintain your results. [1] X Research source The timespan between injections depends on the type of filler you use and how quickly your body metabolizes the filler. [2] X Research source The most common side effects are bruising and soreness, which typically only lasts for a few days. [3] X Research source Most clefts can be filled in with 1 to 2 syringes of filler, with each syringe costing around $600-$1,000. The type of filler you use, your location, and the provider you go to will determine your cost. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Try a fat transfer.
steps.content: Try a fat transfer. Your own fat can act as a natural filler to immediately fill in your cleft chin and smooth the area over. During the procedure, your doctor removes fat from another part of your body, such as your stomach or thighs, and separates the fat from non-fat cells. The fat cells are then injected with a syringe into your cleft. [5] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source You typically only need one fat transfer for lasting results. However, some fat cells do not survive the transfer, so you may feel that you need a second transfer. [6] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Your doctor may prefer to use general or local anesthesia for the procedure. [7] X Research source Fat transfer most commonly results in swelling and bruising. [8] X Research source A fat transfer to your chin averages $2,500. Prices largely depend on how much fat you remove and inject, your location, and your doctorâ€™s practice. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Get a chin implant.
steps.content: Get a chin implant. For this procedure, your doctor cuts a small incision under your chin or inside your mouth and places an implant over your chin bone. The chin implant is made with silicone that feels like your chin tissue, giving you a natural-looking smooth chin. [10] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source Consult with your plastic surgeon to determine the right size and shape of your implant that compliments your face. It takes about 3 months to fully heal from implant surgery. Most patients are able to go about their normal lives a week after surgery. [11] X Research source Chin implant surgery is generally regarded as low risk with most patients experiencing swelling and discomfort after surgery. [12] X Research source Chin implant surgery costs on average $3,000. This average price does not include the cost of anesthesia, other facility costs, or take into account your location and surgeon. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Some people claim facial exercises can soften a cleft chin.
steps.content: Some people claim facial exercises can soften a cleft chin. Face yoga is a popular technique where you use your fingers and hands to pull and sculpt areas of your face to massage and strengthen your muscles. While there is no solid evidence that face yoga can get rid of your cleft chin, some people report that it has helped reduce its appearance. Chin massage : After washing your face, apply a facial oil to your hands. Clench your fist and starting at the bottom of your chin, roll it upwards, making sure it presses into your cleft. Complete this exercise daily, repeating it several times. This may reduce the tension of your muscles and smooth out your cleft. Tongue exercise : Place your tongue to the left side of your mouth and push out, keeping it there for 30 seconds. Repeat this on the right side of your mouth and the front. This exercise claims to reduce your cleft by relaxing your lower jaw muscles, which work harder than your upper jaw and may be the cause of your cleft.

steps.title: Use makeup to conceal your cleft chin.
steps.content: Use makeup to conceal your cleft chin. Apply a wrinkle filler primer onto your cleft to fill in the gap. Wait for the primer to dry and then dab concealer over it to match it to your skin and cover any surrounding shadows. Use a makeup sponge to blend the concealer out into the rest of your skin. Pat on a setting powder to help the primer and concealer stay on all day. Apply foundation on top of the concealed spot and over the rest of your face to further hide your cleft.

steps.title: Conceal your cleft chin by growing a beard.
steps.content: Conceal your cleft chin by growing a beard . A beard is a natural way to hide your cleft chin and can be a permanent solution if you like the look. Choose a style that suits you and follows your hair pattern to achieve a full, thick look.
